channel.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
channel.description:
Hi, i'm making a habbo hotel fansite with radio and im trying to make a dj says. I know how i want it too work Like i have created a back end script that allows people to log on and get deatils about the radio (for the djs only) but i need to make it so that the current dj can set the message and it will display in a marquee...
I know that i could just use a PHP form for this with a <input type="text"> and a submit button.. hmm:/
help??

item.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Well first of all you need to insert a timestamp with each message the DJ sets… Then just use a select query to get the most recent record. eg: SELECT message FROM djsays ORDER BY time_set DESC LIMIT 1

Read full topic
item.source: How can i change text on php page from a form

item.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Ok, i changed it and now its got rid of the notice, How will i get the data out but just the most recent data?

Read full topic
item.source: How can i change text on php page from a form

item.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

You cannot be serious…

mysql_connect(localhost,$username,$password);
should be
mysql_connect(“localhost”,$username,$password);

btw that’s not even an error (it’s a notice), so your code should work anyway?

Read full topic
item.source: How can i change text on php page from a form

item.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

The login script wasnt hard… it was just awkward…

This is my PHP insert into script

<?
$username="poolrise";
$password="*******";
$database="poolrise_djzone";

$message=$_POST['message'];

mysql_connect(localhost,$username,$password);
@mysql_select_db($database) or die( "Unable to select database");

$query = "INSERT INTO djsays VALUES ('','$message')";
mysql_query($query);

mysql_close();

?>

and when i insert i get this error

Notice: Use of undefined constant localhost - assumed 'localhost' in /home/poolrise/public_html/djzone/insert.php on line 36

Read full topic

Well then just do what I said, but without storing the DJ name.

item.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

All the dj does is log in, then at the bottom of the page theres a box that says update DJ Says: then the dj has to type the message and hit submit and it will update the homepage. It doesnt matter what dj does it …

Read full topic
item.source: How can i change text on php page from a form

item.title: How can i change text on php page from a form
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

What do you use to authenticate the DJ’s? If you haven’t done anything, then obviously you need to make the DJ’s login with a username and password for them to see the form that allows them to set the message. You’d just use a normal input on a normal form for this…?

The message can be stored in a table (dj_name, message, time_set), and the latest message can be selected from the table.

Read full topic
